titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Manufacturers' Association of New York annual banquet programs 1986.004
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-08-02 18:12:32 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Manufacturers' Association of New York annual banquet programs
did.abstract: Two programs for the annual banquet of the Manufacturers' Association of New York: one held at the Union League Club in 1908 and one held at the Brooklyn Academy of Music in 1909.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Xerxes Fine and Rare Books and Documents, 1986.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Manufacturers' Association of New York annual banquet programs, 1986.004, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two items from the Manufacturers' Association of New York. One is a program for the Association's 15th annual banquet held at the Union League Club in Brooklyn, dated 1908. The program includes a seating chart and a list of diners. The other is a program for the 16th annual banquet held at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, 1909.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: These items are in the public domain.
